unittitle.value: North (Joseph and Helen Oken) Family Papers

extent.value: in 10 record cartons, 2 oversize flat boxes, 2 shoe boxes, and 1 manuscript box

abstract.value: The North (Joseph and Helen Oken) Family Papers (dated 1913-1990) include three generations of family correspondence and memorabilia spanning from the early 20th century to the 1990s. The bulk of the collection relates to Joseph and Helen North, but a significant portion also relates to Helen's family and includes the papers of her father and mother Morris and Jennie Oken, and her sisters Lydia Oken Mates and Mary Oken Wilson. The collection is largely comprised of correspondence, which documents the North and Oken families' involvement in the Communist Party, socialist activism, labor organizing, the Spanish Civil War, and family life. This collection also contains a significant amount of materials related to Joseph North's career as a journalist for the communist publications <emph render="italic">New Masses</emph> and the <emph render="italic">Daily Worker</emph>.

p.value: Identification of item, date; North (Joseph and Helen Oken) Family Papers; TAM 605; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

Donated by Nora E. North in 2012; additional materials were donated in 2013 and 2016. The accession numbers associated with this collection are NPA.2003.013, 2012.013, 2012.090, 2013.046, and 2017.007.

Helen Oken married Joseph North in 1931. Joseph worked as a correspondent for the <emph render="italic">New Masses</emph> in Spain during the Spanish Civil War. Helen accompanied him to Spain and worked in the medical service during those years. Helen and Joseph later settled in Manhattan and had three children Daniel, Susan, and Nora. Helen continued to be involved in Communist Party activism. She also assumed the role of breadwinner on many occasions, as Joseph's work as a journalist did not provide enough to support a family and often required him to travel abroad. Helen and Joseph were married for 26 year, but eventually divorced in 1957. Helen married Communist Party of the United States leader Gil Green in 1970. Joseph North also remarried, marrying <emph render="italic">Daily World</emph> journalist and editor Augusta Strong in 1963. Joseph's wife Augusta died in early 1976 and Joseph died in December of that same year. Helen North died in 1990.

Many of the correspondents in this collection are addressed by a variety of names throughout their correspondence. Helen and her family often address each other by their Russian names or variations of those names. In much of her correspondence Helen is often addressed as Vezl, Vezlenka, Honushinka, Annunshinka, or Anne. Joseph North, who was born Jacob Soifer, is also addressed as Jacob or Jake on many occasions, and in several instances his letters are addressed to Jacob Sofier.  Helen's sister Lydia is often addressed as  Lidushka, Liducinka, or Lilian, her sister Mary is addressed as Manya or Maninka; her father Morris is frequently referred to as Mitaya, and her mother Jennie, whose name is often spelled Jenny, is often referred to as Jenja.

dsc.value:
Series I: Joseph and Helen Oken North Papers8 boxes1920-1990Scope and Content Note

This series primarily consists of incoming correspondence to Joseph and Helen North from the late 1920s to the 1970s. Correspondence contained in this collection consists of letters from family and friends to Joseph and Helen North. This series also includes materials such as datebooks, account ledgers, handwritten notes, receipts, memorabilia, diplomas, clippings, and drawings.

Subseries I.A: Helen Oken North CorrespondenceScope and Content Note

This sub-series contains incoming correspondence written to Helen North between the 1920s and 1970s. The majority of correspondence written to Helen comes from her sisters, parents, and her husband Joseph North. These letters discuss work, political activism, and family life. A large portion of these letters are in roughly chronological order and are from a wide array of correspondents. Other incoming letters have been grouped by subject or by sender.

Mates2 folders1936-1958416-17Helen Oken North: Incoming Correspondence from Lydia Mates1 folder1958-196551Helen Oken North: Correspondence from Linda Weber1 folder1943-194952Helen Oken North: Incoming Correspondence-Los Angeles 19491 folder194953Helen and Nora North: Los Angeles 19491 folder194954Helen Oken North: Outgoing Correspondence (drafts)1 folder1930s, 1940s, 1950s55Subseries I.B: Joseph North CorrespondenceScope and Content Note

This sub-series contains correspondence related to Joseph North. A large portion this section consists of incoming letters to Joseph North which have been arranged in chronological order. This sub-series also contains letters related to the Spanish Civil War, which have been incorporated into this collection from the Joseph North Spanish Civil War Artifacts, ALBA 294. Many of the letters contained in these folders were written by Joseph North and addressed to his wife Helen.

Joseph North: Incoming Correspondence8 folders1930-195956-18Joseph North Letter to "Comrade Gurewitsch"1 folderundated519Joseph North: Correspondence1 folderundated520Joseph North: Incoming Correspondence - Spanish Civil War2006.0032 folders1936-1938521-22Joseph North: Spanish Civil War Correspondence and Clippings2006.0031 folder1936-1938523Jim Lardner to Joseph North2000.0031 folderundated524Joseph North: Correspondence in Spain2 folders1937-193961-2Joseph North: Incoming Correspondence: Sympathy Regarding Death of Augusta North1 folder197663Joseph North and Nora North: Correspondence1 folder197664Correspondence and Materials related to Death of Joseph North1 folder1976-197765Joseph North: Correspondence and Materials related to I.O.S. speech in Helsinki1 folder197666Joseph North: Notes and Ephemera1 folder197667Jacob Sofier: Correspondence1 folder193268Subseries I.C: Joseph and Helen Oken North CorrespondenceScope and Content Note

This sub-series contains correspondence addressed to both Helen and Joseph North from their friends and family. A significant amount of materials contained within this sub-series also relate to Helen and Joseph's children Daniel, Susan, and Nora North. Many of these letters are addressed to the North children, either individually or collectively, while other letters contained in this section relate to the North children but have been addressed to their mother Helen. There is also a small amount of undated notes and correspondence between Joseph and Helen North.

Joseph and Helen Oken North: Incoming Correspondence7 folders1930-195969-15Joseph and Helen Oken North: Correspondence from Anna Sokolow1 folderundated71Joseph and Helen Oken North: Correspondence from Friends1 folder1938-194872Notes between Joseph and Helen North1 folderundated74Assorted Correspondence between Helen and Joseph North1 folder1938-195073Miscellaneous Correspondence1 folder1930s and 1940s75Joseph and Helen North: Correspondence1 folder1930s-1950s76Notes Helen and Joseph North1 folder1930s77North Children: Notes and Correspondence5 folders1935-195978-12Correspondence regarding Daniel North1 folder1939-1952713Daniel North letters to Helen North-Summer Roadtrip1 folder1948714Notes and Correspondence related to Susan North1 folder1936-1957715Notes and Correspondence related to Nora North1 folder1942-1973716Subseries I.D: Joseph and Helen Oken North Family Records and MemorabiliaScope and Content Note

This sub-series contains a variety of memorabilia related to Joseph and Helen North. Materials related to Joseph and Helen include membership cards, memorabilia, pamphlets, drawings, and ephemera. Several materials contained in this section related to their children including homework, drawings, other memorabilia related to schooling and childhood. There are also several documents related to Joseph and Helen North's financial struggles including documents related to a rent dispute in 1945 and an Internal Revenue Service audit between 1948-1950. Also contained in this sub-series are a number of personal items such as account books, diplomas, date books, wallets and billfolds, notebooks, and autograph books.

This series contains materials related Helen Oken North's parents Morris and Jennie Oken. This series consists of correspondence written to the Okens from friends and family as well as several materials related to union involvement.

Morris and Jennie Oken: Incoming Correspondence4 folders1920-1943829-32Morris and Jennie Oken: Incoming Correspondence6 folders1944-195391-6Morris Oken: Correspondence Regarding Injury at New York Naval Yard1 folder1945-194697Mary Oken Wilson Correspondence1 folder1944-195398Morris Oken: International Workers Order Flyers and Pamphlets1 folder1946-195299Morris and Jennie Oken: Notes and Clippings1 folder1950s910Morris Oken: Labor Organizations2 folders1920s-1950s911-12Morris and Jennie Oken: Labor Organizations1 folder1951-1953913Morris Oken: Membership Cards and Membership Books1 folder1913-1946914Morris and Jennie Oken: Notebooks and Billfolds1 folderundated915Series III: Lydia Oken Mates Papers 1 box1921-1975Scope and Content Note

This series contains the papers of Helen Oken North's sister Lydia Oken Mates and her husband Dave Mates. This series is comprised primarily of correspondence written to Lydia by her sisters and parents. Some correspondence is also addressed to Dave Mates. Also included in this series are union membership cards; materials related to Lydia's education including diplomas, a graduation program, and an autograph book; and other assorted ephemera.

Lydia Oken Mates: Incoming Correspondence13 folders1921-1965916-26101-2Dave and Lydia Oken Mates: Incoming Correspondence5 folders1959-1974103-7Lydia Oken Mates: collection of Letters of Daniel North to his mother Helen North1 folderAug. 1948-Dec.1948108Lydia Oken Mates: Letters and Clippings related to the death of Alice Herz1 folderMar. 1965-May 1965109Dave and Lydia Oken Mates: Materials related to Communism in China and Vietnam1 folder19741010Dave Mates: Sales Reports1 folder19671011Lydia Oken Mates: Diplomas and Certificates1923-1927MSOS006Walton High School Graduation Program1 folderJan. 26, 19271012Lydia Oken Mates: English Assignment "The Modern School of Stelton"1 folderMay 3, 19271013Lydia Oken Mates: Labor Union Membership Cards1 folder19291014Lydia Oken Mates: Autograph Book1 folder1924-19271015Dave and Lydia Oken Mates: "Museum of First Congress-CPC" Postcards1 folderundated1016Memorial Materials: Harry and Esther North, Abe Soifer1 folder2002-20031017Lydia Oken Mates: Sketches1 folderundated1018Lydia Oken Mates: Brochures and Clippings related to art1 folderundated1019Dave Mates Wallet1 folderundated1020Cocolo by Bettina Elrich 1 folderJan. 1, 19451021News of Peace 1 folderOct. 1951-Mar. 19531022Series IV: Photographs0.75 Linear Feet1935-1972Scope and Content Note

This series consists primarily photographs and negatives related to Joseph and Helen Oken North and Dave and Lydia Mates. Images related to Joseph and Helen North consist of prints and negatives that date from 1935-1937 and depict their son Daniel as a baby and other events with friends and family from those years. Images related to Dave and Lydia Mates date from the 1950s to the 1970s and document their various travels, including trips to China and Russia.

This series contains artifacts related the Spanish Civil War including a hat taken off of a Moorish soldier who died in the war, a record of Flamenco music, and Spanish castanets. The series also contains an Odessa sailor's hat and several assorted pins and metals related to various Communist and peace organizations.
